keyMoments.description: Discovers the skull-shaped island connection by overlaying maps of Jaya and Skypiea, solving the 400-year-old mystery of the City of Gold's location
keyMoments.significance: Major navigational breakthrough that validates Mont Blanc Noland's story and provides the crew with their target location

keyMoments.description: Identifies the Skull's Right Eye as the specific location of the City of Gold in Upper Yard
keyMoments.significance: Solves Noland's riddle and gives the crew a precise destination for their expedition

keyMoments.description: Punches the wolf pack leader to settle the misunderstanding and prevent conflict
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates her authority within the crew and ability to resolve conflicts decisively

keyMoments.description: Explains the concept of vearth (soil) to the Straw Hats and its sacred significance to sky islanders
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial cultural context for understanding the 400-year war over Upper Yard and why the conflict is so intense

keyMoments.description: Sustains injuries while protecting Raki from danger during the Shandia retreat
keyMoments.significance: Shows his dedication to protecting his companions and the Shandia warriors' bond with each other

keyMoments.description: Despite injuries, expresses determination to defeat Enel and reclaim Upper Yard so the Shandia no longer need to cherish small bags of vearth
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the Shandia's unwavering commitment to reclaiming their homeland regardless of personal sacrifice

keyMoments.description: Leads the Shandia warriors in resolving internal conflicts and committing to reclaim Upper Yard
keyMoments.significance: Establishes his leadership role and the Shandia's unified determination for the coming battle

keyMoments.description: Protected by Kamakiri during the Shandia retreat from battle
keyMoments.significance: Shows the protective bonds within the Shandia warrior tribe
